title: Bank of Mexico Lifts Interest Rates for Seventh Time
sub_head: Overnight interest-rate target raised from 6% to 6.5% in unanimous decision
body:
The Bank of Mexico raised interest rates for a seventh consecutive time Thursday, citing higher inflation expectations, the tightening of global monetary conditions, and uncertainty stemming from the Ukraine conflict.
The central bankâ€™s five-member board of governors voted unanimously in favor of a half percentage point increase in the overnight interest-rate target to 6.5%, taking it to its highest level since April 2020.
